<div style="padding-left:45px;">
## Exercise  7.2 {1/1}

</div>

<div style="padding-left:60px;">
### <a href="javascript:showhide('Problem ')">Problem </a>

<div id="Problem " style="display:none;">

Explain in what sense the regression sum of squares $SSR(X_1)$ is an extra sum of squares.

</div>
</div>

<div style="padding-left:70px;">
<!-- Type Problem here -->

### Solution
<!-- Type Solution here -->

The extra sum of squares is such because of the multiple variables. We are comparing the $SSR$ given multiple variables, holding that all other variables are included. This means that we are comparing the $SSR$ when certain variables are already in the model.

</div>
